data.title: The Wisdom of Charlie Chan
data.text:
Biography Quotes Filmography

Charlie Chan, the fictional Chinese-American police detective first appeared in Earl der Bigger's novel, House Without a Key (1925). The novel is set in Hononulu, where Chan is a detective on the police force. A total of six novels featured Chan:

The House Without a Key (1925)

The Chinese Parrot (1926)

Behind That Curtain (1928)

The Black Camel (1929)

Charlie Chan Carries On (1930)

Keeper of the Keys (1932)

On film Charlie Chan first appears in earnest in Charlie Chan Carries On (1931) starring Warner Oland. One feature of the movie adaptations is Chan's frequent use of Chinese proverbs and quotes at appropriate moments. These are the focus of this website.

You can learn more about Charlie Chan here:

Wikipedia entry

charliechan.net

"Charle Chan Family Home" (This site has it's own list of aphorisms!)

All these links are working as of September 2010. ###
